instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3435: What is 820-3435? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 1.6v
threads.message: At first i got orange light ppbus is 1.6v but doesn't short to ground, i tried to change isl, <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> at same time, but now i don have pp3v42, or even ppbus and ppdcin, does.this mean there's leakage? <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 1.6v
threads.message:
Be sure all changed components are correctly soldered.
Check again diode mode at L7095 and F7140.

Post exact ohm value for <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86, measured onboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3435</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus 1.6v
threads.message:
i have resoldered all..
l7095 : 0.280
f7140 pin 1 : 0.505
pin 2 : 0.404

<RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> 67kohm
<RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR> 100 kohm
<RESISTOR>R7181</RESISTOR> 55 kohm
<RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR> 5 kohm
